javaly.core

Annotation Type TestCase


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface TestCase
    @TestCase is an annotation that tells our test engine which methods are test cases. This is to allow our test engine to catch any exceptions that may occur when the user runs the code. All test cases must be defined within methods and be annotated with the @TestCase tag. If you wish to make your test cases hidden from the user, please include the hidden=true parameter as below By default, hidden will be falss, i.e. the user will be able to see the expected output of the test. Note that the test case method can be of any name should not take in any arguments and the visibility should be public

    Usage is as below:

    Let's say your question expects a student to define the following function

    public static int add(int a, int b){return a + b;}

    You would have the following Test class: 

     import static javaly.core.Test.*;
 import javaly.core.*;
 public class StagingMethodTest{
  @TestCase(expectedOutput = "5")
  public void test0() throws Exception {
   assertEquals(5, MethodHolder.add(2, 3));
  }

  @TestCase(expectedOutput = "6")
  public void test1() throws Exception {
   assertEquals(6, MethodHolder.add(3, 3));
  }

  @TestCase(expectedOutput = "-1", hidden=true)
  public void test2() throws Exception {
    assertEquals(-1, MethodHolder.add(-4, 3));
  }

 }

    Or more generally: 

     import static javaly.core.Test.*;
 import javaly.core.*;
 //other import statements
 ...

 public class GenericTest{
  @TestCase (expectedOutput = "Expected string to display in case of error")
  public void testX() throws Exception{
    //preparation code
    ...
    //test code
    assertEquals([description,] expectedObject, outputObject);
    ...
  }
  //for system.out questions
  @TestCase (expectedOutput = "Expected string to display in case of error")
  public void testSysOut() throws Exception{
    //preparation code
    ...
    //test code
    methodThatPrintsToSysOut();
    assertEquals([description,] expectedObject, retrieveSystemOutput());
    ...
  }
 }

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String expectedOutput 
      boolean hidden 

    • Element Detail

      • expectedOutput

        public abstract java.lang.String expectedOutput
        Default:
        ""

      • hidden

        public abstract boolean hidden
        Default:
        false
